column3: Thanks, makes sense, if `std` has something that's usually preferable to using third party APIs.
Concept ACK: less cruft is better.
ACK c19ceb4. Tested on macOS 10.14.6 against depends (always spits out a trillion warnings at the end) as well as homebrew 5.13.0 (quite a few deprecation warnings remaining, but not these).

May I suggest to add `include <algorithm>` to the all modified `*.cpp` files?

From [Developer Notes - Source code organization](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#source-code-organization):
> - Every `.cpp` and `.h` file should `#include` every header file it directly uses classes, functions or other definitions from, even if those headers are already incl

FWIW looks like these were marked deprecated in Qt 5.2:
> - QtAlgorithms
  With STL no longer being optional for building and using Qt, a number of parts
  of QtAlgorithms no longer make sense, and have therefore been deprecated.
Could the comment be fixed by removing/replacement mentions of `qLowerBound()` and `qUpperBound()`?
Agree, let's keep the comment but with the new method names
Have reinstated the comment, using the new method names.
